result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason T Hawley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today (10/7/2016).
Must follow rules of supervision and all other parts of agreement.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office from Bond with balance to be returned to poster.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office from Bond with balance to be returned to poster.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.

timeConds.notes:
Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.
Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.

2:19 Defendant Jason T Hawley in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  Per ADA - agreement.  VR complied.  DE gives up rights to PSI.  All motions filed have been withdrawn.  PQWR.  Ct finds DE FVI&K enters plea.  No Firearm.  Civil Rights.  DE pleads G to Count 1 - Ct finds DE Guilty.  Judgment entered.  Counts 2, 3 & 4 - R/I Dismissed.   Atty Repka addresses Ct.  

SENTENCING: Ct - Count 1 - Class E felony.  Ct - 5 years probation.  Fines/costs $290.60, DNA surcharge of $250.00.  Fines/costs to be paid thru probation.  9 months conditional jail time to be banked by probation, subj to WR not subj to GT.  Follow rules of supervision, follow all other parts of agreement.  DE to report probation today 10-7-16.  Bond to be applied to fines/costs and any balance to be returned.  2:47 adj.
